s1.ptxt: Remove compressor from vehicle referring to Compressor Assembly Removal and Installation .
Fix armature plate (1) with special tool (A) and remove armature plate bolt.

attention3.ptxt: Do not reuse armature plate bolt.

s1.ptxt: Using special tool (A), remove snap ring (1).
Remove magnet clutch pulley (1) with puller (2).

attention3.ptxt: Be careful not to damage pulley.

s1.ptxt: Remove snap ring (1) using special tool (B), and then remove magnet clutch coil (1).

attention3.ptxt: Protrusion (1) on underside of magnet clutch coil and hole (2) on compressor body assembly must match to stop movement of magnet clutch coil and to locate lead wire correctly.

s1.ptxt: Install new snap ring (1) using special tool (A).

s2.ptxt: Set magnet clutch horizontally over clutch installation boss.
Place special tool (B) onto magnet clutch bearing. Ensure that edge rests only inner rase of bearing.
Install new snap ring (1) using special tool (A).

s1.ptxt: Using special tool (A), tighten new armature plate bolt (2) to specified torque.
Adjust clearance between armature plate (1) and magnet clutch pulley by putting shim(s) on compressor shaft. To measure the clearance, perform the following steps.

s2.ptxt: Set dial gauge on magnet clutch plate, and then adjust its pointer at 0.
Connect battery positive terminal (+) to magnet clutch coil lead wire.
Connect battery negative terminal (–) to compressor body assembly. (At this point, armature plate and magnet clutch pulley (2) are kept in contact.)
Disconnect battery negative terminal (–) to compressor body assembly (At this point, armature plate and magnet clutch pulley (2) are not in contact.)
Read stroke of armature plate from dial gauge by performing Step d) and e) repeatedly. (Stroke of armature plate is clearance between armature plate and magnet clutch pulley (2).)

spec.title: Standard clearance between armature plate and magnet clutch

s1.ptxt: Install compressor to vehicle referring to Compressor Assembly Removal and Installation .
